definition:
A lattice in ${{\mathbb{R}}}^n$ is an $n$-dimensional additive free
group over ${\mathbb{Z}}$ which generates ${{\mathbb{R}}}^n$ over
${\mathbb{R}}$.

[**Example**]{}: The following is an example of a lattice
$\mathcal{L}\subset {{\mathbb{R}}}^2$, generated by
$w_1=(1,2),w_2=(4,1)$.

$$\mathcal{L}=\{ \alpha w_1 +\beta w_2 \mid \alpha,\beta \in {\mathbb{Z}}\}$$

![image](lattice)
